review: I've had it for a couple weeks now and am enjoying it very much.  I'm going to downsize my Dish package to just the basic so I can keep my local channels. I don't care about watching episodes a week later and I can do that with all the apps available.  I'm going to try the Prime free trial this week and see how that works out. If I like it I'll cancel my Netflix account since you can only stream old stuff with them and none of the new movies.  The annual fee for Prime works out to about the same as the monthly fee for Netflix.

review: Product is defective. Keeps losing network connection every few minutes, when all of my other wifi devices are working fine. Saw online that this is a very common problem with the FireStick. Very glitchy. Would like to give it a second try and get a replacement. If that replacement is glitchy as well, then I will return the product for a refund. The short experience I had with the FireStick is enjoyable, but maybe it was too soon to put on the market? This would have been an amazing product if it actually worked properly as intended.
author: Mary E.

review: In the last few days, I think Amazon has finally update the Stick software to allow Windows 8.1 devices to mirror via Miracast.  I was just now able to use my Windows RT tablet and Windows 8.1 laptop to "Project My Screen" to my TV via the Fire TV Stick.  (Charms --> Devices --> Project -->  Add the Fire TV Stick as a device, and let all the drivers load.)  I can send video and audio when I'm on websites, but I'm having trouble sending audio when I'm on apps like Netflix, XBox Video, etc.  I'm poking around to see if there's some setting I need to change.  Still, after months of being disappointed that I couldn't "Project My Screen" to the Fire TV Stick, I'm very encouraged by the new development.
